label: 天平尺
対訳語: The standard unit of measuring length in the Nara period (29.6 cm)
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: The standard unit of measuring length in the Nara period was the Tempyō shaku (29.6cm) , which was based on the Tang-dynasty equivalent, the chi (also 29.6cm) . A shaku is made up of 10 sun, and 1 sun comprises 10 bu. The kane shaku used today in Japan is longer than its predecessor at 30.3 cm. [寸、分、曲尺]
